sentence.Network_en: Keep a pad handy to jot down queries as they occur.
sentence.Network_cn: 手边放一本便笺簿，以便有问题时随时记下。

sentence.Network_en: Listen carefully to the instructions and jot them down.
sentence.Network_cn: 仔细听指示，并记录下来。

sentence.Network_en: Could you just jot his name on there?
sentence.Network_cn: 你能把他的名字先记在那上面吗？

He jotted down the conceits of his idle hours ., 他记下了闲暇时想到的一些看法.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as a noun): via Latin from Greek iōta, the smallest letter of the Greek alphabet (see iota)

entry.tran: 草草记下，匆匆写下（地址等）
entry.def: If you jot something short such as an address somewhere, you write it down so that you will remember it.

example.ex: Could you just jot his name on there?
example.tran: 你能把他的名字先记在那上面吗？

entry.def: If you say that there is not a jot or not one jot of something, you are emphasizing that there is not even a very small amount of it.

example.ex: There is not a jot of evidence to say it does them any good...
example.tran: 没有丝毫的证据显示这对他们有任何好处。

example.ex: It makes not one jot of difference.

entry.tran: （用于强调否定陈述）丝毫，一点儿
entry.def: Expressions such as a jot ,one jot ,not a jot are used to emphasize negative statements.

example.ex: It doesn't affect my judgement one jot...
example.tran: 这丝毫不会影响我的判断。

sentences.sentence: "this dish could use a touch of garlic"

means.word_mean: 1. write briefly or hurriedly; write a short note of

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Goodness me, you haven't changed one jot.

auth_sentence.content: She was not a jot more lucid than I was.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was not a jot more lucid than I was.

auth_sentence.content: I tend to mislay the notes I jot down as reminders.

means.word_mean: 草草记下； 匆匆记下

sentences.cn: 我匆忙记下了她的名字。

sentences.en: I’ll jot down their address before I forget it.
sentences.cn: 我得赶快把他们的地址写下来，免得忘了。
